review: I play guitar and keyboard and, sometimes, I need to quickly put guitar on my back to play keyboards. I would not do that without this straplok.
I put this in my Fender MIM Stratocaster. I want to change that "poor" string guides that came in MIM by the American Series string guide. So nice...
This acessorie is well builded and don't change the guitar's pitch. No damages guitars neck. It's so easy to use
I put this pickguard in a MIM White Blonde Stratocaster, and guitar looks so great. I didn't need any kind of adaptation to put in my guitar.

I have a Fender Stratocaster MIM with standard white pickguard, which I changed by a black one. Then I decided also change others white pieces, and this Fender Accessory Kit fit perfect in my guitar. I didn't need no adaptation to install it on guitar.
I'm using this pedal like a clean boost for leads, and I'm very happy with it's sound. Uncolored +20db of clean gain...

This gear is for who wants a versatile overdrive pedal. It's go from light overdrives on channel 1 to heavy drives on boost channel. With mini trim pots you can add some flavor to the sound.On the other side, you can't use boost channel without drive channel.
I bought this unit for a friend, and I could compare with others overdrives I already have. I think the MXR Badass Custom Modified Overdrive or Way Huge Green Rhino are better choise.
This unit is like a old blue jeans. Problaly exist betters pedals, but it's produce the vintage overdrive that match with everything...
I like a lot this pedal. It's has a deep overdrive. I'm using 18Vdc to supply power, and it deliverys a fat overdrive. I'm using a TS808 in front of OCD...
Very good tunner, with bypass switch. I think it's a good choise for any pedalboards. I changed this for a TC Electronic Polytune.
This unit produce a warm and vintage sound of a analog delay. It's not so "digital and bright" delay like Boss DD3 or DD7. Mod switch adds a perfect "chorus" effect for 80's Metal Ballads sound.
This tuner is wonderful. You can tune all strings in same time. It's halpfull in stage, because you don't need to test each string individually.
With this power supply you can offer to your pedals 9Vdc, 12Vdc, 18Vd or 12Vac. I'm using 8 pedals conected to this power supply, and I don't have any kind of noise or hum.
I bought this unit because my amp doesn't have reverb. But I discovered that this little pedal can give you greats sounds. Even when I use a reverbed amp, I turn it off and use my Hall of Fame.

This single pedal unit has a lot of  amazing and suprising effects. A lot of overdrive/distortions, filters, modulations, delays, reverbs, all carefully modeled. I put M5 side-by-side with the "real one" with a A/B switch, and don't heard differences. I'm using in musics where I need programed delays (like U2 or Pink Floyd) or when I need a specific effect - I only use Tremolo in 1 music, and this gear help me to save my money.
I had used some Boss CE-5 and CH-1 and substituted them with this unit. It's has a cool analog/vintage sound of chours.
You can set up 3 delays configurations, what is a interesting option to use on stage. Tap function also helps a lot. All type of delays are sounds beatiful...
It's a well build daisy chain DC power cable. It has good lenght between two plugs. You won't have difficulties to plug your pedals.
This pedal is great help on stage. It's fast and accurate, and with polytune "option" you can easily find which string is out of tune.
